poem.title: Concrete Sound
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Sweeps in sneaks out or vice versa.
Orthodontal squeaks and streaks of print. He
Speaks but doesn’t say what good he seeks,
Maybe a jeep, seats four on leather
Three-piece suites to cruise the streets.
Or maybe a negotiated cease-fire.
Grey water seeps as somebody steeps and wrings
Steeps and wrings. The plumbing never sleeps.
And these ants in chitin crinolines
Running on their elbows. Stop it!
